channel.title: Logseq on bg
channel.description: Recent content in Logseq on bg

item.title: Typeface Matters
item.description: At work and at home I have used logseq as my personal knowledge management system (PKMS) since some time in 2022. Most of the time I just used it to store and browse script-generated documentation, for example of database schemas (SAP etc.). Generated documentation pages are usually long lists of short texts, one to three words max. A single page for each database table with a list of column names, their data types and short description. Thus, my PKMS contained barely any text written in full paragraphs. Despite the fact that I like writing and editing longer text, I wouldn’t have done that in logseq in the past.
